text: Endless green, lush and wild, extends to the horizon...as soar with two MILITARY HELICOPTERS. On a mission.

A COMBAT BOOT splashes down amidst torrential rain. It be to CAPTAIN JOHN CARTER (28), of Dev Group, the most elite special forces units. He’s handsome but world-weary. A wi beyond his years. He spins at a close sound -- rifle now aimed at a tiny RE LIZARD, who regards him like a visitor from another plane

(into radio) Clear. Three seconds later, a DOZEN ARMY RANGERS fast rope into all around him, at the base of their tethers-- --dropping from the two HELICOPTERS hovering above. The C WASH whips the terrain, but the rainstorm drowns the soun little lizard darts away for his life. A soldier lands next to Carter -- JAMES POWELL (27), all tattoos, attitude, rock & roll. James Dean with a captain commission. They trade a nod. Nice landing. And then watch as a CIA MAN descends on the last tether, the clearing, crashing through branches and landing in a on his ass. Amused, Powell locks to Carter:
War is hell.
A BINOCULAR POV of a jungle settlement -- a village of hu shacks, now occupied by members of an AFRICAN REBEL ARMY. handful of ragtag SOLDIERS, one with a Stinger launcher.
Ten I can see. AK's, RPG‘S...two Jeeps with machine gun mounts. Intel's right about the Stingers. Carter (lowering the binocs), lies next to Powell, hidden jungle’s edge.
The villagers are being held ina school house on the northeast edge.
Take five men from the east and eliminate every rebel you encounter. I'll do the same from the south.
What about the civilians? Powell doesn’t answer.
We're here to liberate them... right?
If possible.
What have you and that spook cooked up? Powell gives Carter a long look.

Okay. You gotta right to know. Story is some gemstone showed up at a London jeweler’s. The CIA got hold of it. Turns out to be a whole new type of mineral. Never seen before. Has some amazing properties. Lots of uses. Lasers...and other tech stuff. They traced it back to this village. We've been ordered to locate and secure the source. Everything else is secondary.
Once again, they feed us a phony story so we’ll do their dirty work.
It's the job.
Maybe. But I’m still coming in from the Northeast. Carter starts to head out. Powell sighs.
Bad tactics. But we’ll all go in from the Northeast. Isolate the civilians first.  3. Powell sticks out his fist. Carter bumps it with his fist
Still friends?
Womb to tomb.
KABOOM! CONCUSSION GRENADES blast through the walls, caus quartet of REBEL OFFICERS to dive for cover. Maps and min samples scatter to the ground--

--as the Army Ranger unit STORMS the village from all sid SHARPSHOOTERS lay down cover fire, as Carter, Powell and race to cover of mud huts-- --picking off REBELS as‘they'race into view, guns blazing chaotic urban warfare, deep in a remote jungle. Carter and Powell advance with care as RAT-A-TATATATA! -- AUTOMATIC FIRE eats up the dirt dead ahead. A GUNNER in a thatched-roof tower atop a tribal worship house fires a M GUN. Carter’s on his radio:
Sniper in the compound! A REBEL JEEP pulls into view from the other direction. Tw rebels with Kalashnikovs take a bead on Carter and Powell
--forcing them to dive inside as mud walls get RIDDLED wi gunfire. Holes POP just above the level of their heads. P glares at Carter, who frowns--
What?
Never say it’s your last mission.
Carter and Powell dart out another way, trading FIRE with chasing Jeep. Powell takes out the DRIVER and the Jeep cr Carter sees the Tower Gunner facing the other way--
Cover. --and races for the worship house. Powell lays cover fire

BOOM! Carter blows through the door, picking off two REBE OFFICERS before they can fire back. The building has been converted into a rebel command post. A SENIOR OFFICER sta FIRING, as Carter dives for cover-- --falling amidst MAPS, CHARTS and SOIL SAMPLES. Massive m of DIRT and CRUSHED ROCK fall around him. Geological test EQUIPMENT tumbles off tables as GUNFIRE rings out. Carter braces for a shot -- and now sees the SENIOR OFFIC his gun to the head of a FEMALE VILLAGER, bound in an interrogation chair. The officer SHOUTS threats--— --and Carter doesn’t hesitate. BAM! be theese His shot kills the Officer. Carter springs to the ladder-stairs to the Tower and clim behind the Machine Gunner, levelling his rifle-- --as the Machine Gunner whirls on him and OPENS FIRE-- --just as Carter DROPS back through the trap door, landin The Hulking Gunner abandons his post and LEAPS through th in pursuit. With a huge machete-- --and CRASH! Carter blocks the machete strike with his ri wielding it like a two-handed sword. The Gunner CLASHFS a and Carter parries. The huge rebel drives Carter back, SL madly-- --and KNOCKING the gun from Carter’s hands. Carter hits t deck. The Gunner plants a BOOT on his neck just as Carter for his ankle-holstered pistol-- --and the machete comes down just as the pistol goes up-- --and BAM! The Gunner falls. Sideways. Carter looks to see Powell in the doorway, rifle smoking. both catch their breath, exhausted...
I had him.
Whatever you say.  5. The sounds of GUNFIRE fade, replaced by SHOUTS of “All Se Their unit's taken the village. They swiftly free the bon the female prisoner-- A ranger arrives on the scene.
The village has been taken. All civilians are safe and secure in the school.
Help her to the others. The Ranger escorts the Woman out. Carter picks up MAPS fr scattered rock samples and equipment...
Well, they were up here looking for rocks, all right.

(a strange tone) Yeah. Yeah they were. 4 And Carter turns to see what Powell’s staring at... On the tribal altar, there’s a SUNDIAL-shaped totem made baked red clay...with six gem-sized indentations in it -- - encircling a larger center indentation. It is filled with an INCANDESCENT FIRE-RED GEMSTONE, whic lit from within by an otherworldly glow. The gem absolute takes their breath away. And off their looks of pure amazement...

ARMY RANGERS cut the locks on the doors-- ~-as IMPRISONED VILLAGERS spill out, bound and blindfolde soldiers free their bonds and the villagers embrace them- --as Carter and Powell watch from the worship house door. CIA Man arrives, storming right past them--
It’s in there, Spooky.

The rain has stopped as HELICOPTERS set down, bringing su personnel...and more INTELLIGENCE OPERATIVES, who are rus toward the worship house by the CIA Man. At the village's edge, Carter and Powell sit, scraping mu their boots, looking like hell...
I'm gonna miss saving your life, you know.
Won't miss saving yours.
We get home, we're gonna change our minds. We'll take two weeks and want to be right back in it. Carter smiles. Shakes his head.
What about the private security work? You still thinking about it? Us ex- Dev Group guys can make a lot of money.
I'm tired of killing.
But you're so good at it.
Ironic. Isn't it? Another Ranger voice CRACKLES over Powell’‘s radio--
Gold Team -- South Perimeter -- please report.
We got jungle and more jungle. Anybody needs some, send ‘em on over. He clicks off. Carter still surveys the jungle...
I'm just trying to picture you -- back there in the Blue Ridge, building your little house on a hill without a war to fight. Carter smiles.

I‘11 send you a postcard. And suddenly a RUSTLING in the jungle springs them to the feet! Their rifles are ready, instantly on alert... ..-and then Carter, scanning the trees, spots A PAIR OF E amidst jungle foliage.
Ten o'clock! A DARK FIGURE takes off running -- just as Carter sights rifle. Carter and Powell leap into action!
Go, go, go!
The two soldiers CRASH through the underbrush, giving cha

(into radio) We‘ve got a rebel on the south perimeter! We're in pursuit! --as they SMASH through huge leaves and dangling vines, a fleeing FIGURE stays far ahead of them, visible only as a DISTURBANCE in the overgrown jungle.
Carter and Powell LEAP a stream, as more LIZARDS watch-- --and keep CRASHING through dense jungle, running hard an blind, finally bursting through into a--

Where a few VINES hang down, just overhead, from high tre They catch their breath, listening for movement-- --and then see a RUSTLING in the jungle ahead. Then sever yards further. And further still. Powell starts for it--  8. --but Carter grabs his arm. Powell frowns. Carter points the vine right beside his head. It’s swaying gently, whil rest of the vines are not. Together, they grip their rifles...and snap them upward--

head_text.subj: TO SEE A YOUNG AFRICAN BOY

text: Clutching the vine twenty feet above them. He wears a sat and has a handful of stones he's been throwing. Surprised two friends hold their fire... CARTER . (in broken dialect) Climb down, we won't hurt you. We're not with the rebels. But the Boy remains clinging, scared. Powell’s had enough

The hell with this. --as he raises his rifle and FIRES -- snapping the vine! --and sending the AFRICAN BOY tumbling twenty feet to the He lands on his butt, as his satchel spills open and-- SIX MORE INCANDESCENT RED “FIRE-GEMS” Fall out, GLOWING MAGICALLY as if from within. Carter and Powell's eyes go wide. The Boy gasps, then scrambles to r them...but Powell keeps him at bay...
Carter...?
Yeah. I see ‘em. Carter picks up the glowing stones, with wonderment...

Your village...did they tell you to hide these? From the rebels? How long have you been out here hiding? The Boy trembles. He looks like he hasn't eaten in weeks. Carter trades a look with Powell...and puts the stones ba the boy’s satchel.
I want you to take these back to your people. Don't let our soldiers see them. They belong to you.
Carter, what are you doing? Carter hands the grateful boy the satchel.
Now I want you to tell me something. The Boy nods.
Those rocks. Do you know where your village found them? Another nod.

Carter, Powell and the Boy push through the foliage to em an overlook -- with a view of e lush MOUNTAIN RANGE risin the clouds. Near'*the base, a JAGGED CREVASSE cuts into t range like a deep, black scar. The Boy is happily devouring a Baby Ruth candy bar as he to the canyon and speaks a single African word.
He says “the cave.” He raises binocs, intrigued. Powell consults a map:
Whatcha got on that crevasse?
It's not here. It’s not charted.
There was an earthquake around here a year ago. Could’ve opened it up. They trade a long look...as their radios CRACKLE:
Base to Gold Team, base to Gold Team...report on pursuit. Carter raises his radio...until Powell takes it away:
Uh, yeah, we lost that rebel...still out here searching. (MORE)
POWELL (cont'd) Might've found their supply route, though. Gonna have a look. May take some time.
Copy that. Good luck, Gold Team.
Thanks. We'll need it. Powell clicks off..-.and meets Carter's gaze...
Carter and Powell trek toward the crevasse, hacking jungl
We're taking a look, right? A look.
That is the mission.
We take a gem, it’s a court-martial.
We take one, we take ten, I know.
We don’t even know what they’re worth--
Besides killing for. Suddenly, the narrow CREVASSE opens up before them. ominous ribbon, a crack in the earth. Depth unknown.
We’ve been doing this for fifteen years. For who, our country? No. NSA, CIA, guys like Spooky. Their wars, their agendas. What are we leaving this Army with?
We're alive. There's that. Powell studies the dark abyss, with a measured tone:

You ever seen gems like that? How much land in the Blue Ridge you think one of them buys? Forget private security work. A few of those rocks and we never have to kill anyone ever again. A dark  ll. Carter weighs this. Powell pushes the moment.
We've been best friends for fifteen years right?
More or less.
How many times before this have I asked you to break the rules?
I‘ve lost count.
So what's one more? Carter laughs. Powell holds a hopeful stare.
Alright, but after we find the stones we're going to turn them over to the brass.
After I put a few aside for my old age.
That’s between you and your court- martial tribunal.
Powell DESCENDS on a rope line, lowered by Carter. He fee way down jagged walls, scanning a light across the walls spotting flecks of worthless QUARTZ and MICA.
Lots of rocks -- no pretty redheads!
How far down you figure? Powell scans with his light. Still only blackness.
Good goddamn question. More rope?! Fifty feet above him, a silhouetted Carter shakes his hea below, Powell now spots a series of LEDGES, like a natura staircase. He starts swinging himself--  12.
There's some ledges here, I think I can get a little deeper-- --and as he swings, the rope FRAYS against some rock...bu Powell grabs hold in time. He perches on a ledge--
Okay, I'm gonna unhook-- --and as he unclips from the rope line, the ledge CRUMBLE Powell flails and tumbles, plummeting into darkness! His TERRIFYING YELL echoes -- and then abruptly cuts silent.
Powell?! POWELL!!! No response.
Carter tears back into the foliage, SLASHING at long,’ st vines...and hustling to tie their ends together...

With the vines secured to a tree, Carter takes a knife an carves a STAR AND TWO STRIPES symbol into the tree. Then backs to the edge of the crevasse. His FLASHLIGHT is tape his belt, aimed downward. He takes a deep breath--
I‘m coming for you.
Far away, Carter disappears into the crevasse. Watching h the African Boy..-.wearing an enigmatic stare:
Goodbye, soldier. He crunches another bite of Baby Ruth. And he’s gone.

Carter rappels through the opening, navigating far past t crumbling ledges and the end of Powell's rope-- --and then his light finds the bottom of the crevasse. Wi broken end of Powell’s rope. And traces of BLOOD.  13. Carter scrambles to the end of his vines...and drops six the crevasse floor. He scans his light...following drops blood...to the dark, jagged mouth of a CAVE.
Carter wanders through the pitch darkness--

Powell?! Can you hear me? There's no reply. But his light illuminates STRANGE MARKI the walls -- characters, shapes and symbols in an unknown language. Intrigued, Carter edges deeper-~- --and now his LIGHT picks up a GLINT OF RED. He stops sti Ahead, through an archway, he sees twinkling RED LIGHTS - dozens of them -- like constellations in the sky. He stumbles closer, passing through the archway into--

A massive chamber, a domed room thirty feet high with tho of mystical RED FIRE-GEM CRYSTALS in the walls. More MARKINGS, coordinates in an unknown language, are ca bas-relief all around the base of the chamber. The room w clearly built by an intelligence...but whose? Carter marvels, circling the room. He runs his hands acro fire-gems. They shimmer BRIGHTER to his touch.

What is this...? Then, Carter spots something in the middle of the room. A SUNDIAL-type marking in the ground. Like a compass charti both time and space. And as he edges closer--~ --he kneels to examine it, seeing a large DIAMOND-like st the center, reflecting infinite facets. And as he just ba touches it with one of his hands--

head_text.subj: THE ENTIRE CHAMBER RUMBLES WITH ENERGY

text: As if ACTIVATED. The “sundial” Carter’s kneeling on LOWER abruptly into the ground, causing a WHITE GLOW to spill o instinct, Carter scrambles aside-- --and sees the canopy of FIRE-GEMS GLOW BRIGHTER, as if instantly charged. They CRACKLE with energy, as the HUM g deafening, and RED BEAMS of ENERGY “connect” linking all erystals in a spiderweb network--  14. Carter's astonished...as a SWIRLING WIND begins to build, the FIRE-GEMS glow hotter, illuminating PREHISTORIC FOSSI the walls, embedded DINOSAURS and MASTODONS--~- --while the dinosaur and mastodon fossils GROW SKIN AND P and suddenly COME TO LIFE, as meanwhile the cavern ceilin SPLITS APART to reveal the night sky high above-- --and the HUM grows deafening and the GLOW blinding and t now SPINNING at impossible speed as Carter sees--

As the rock above him retracts and the DINOSAURS clamber backwards from their eternal resting places and Carter's buffeted body shakes as if it's being ripped apart-- --in the maelstrom of sound and light and time which casc into a sudden SONIC BOOM!
In a distant angle, DINOSAURS watch as a PILLAR OF RED-HO fires straight up into the universe beyond.

Amidst a low blanket of reeds and tall grasses, RED ENERG CRACKLES and SPARKS. Angle rises to reveal a circle of flattened, burned grasses...with John Carter, unconscious scorched and battered, at its center. Carter struggles up. Disoriented and nauseous. Confused t he‘s no longer in the crevasse cave. He's surrounded by strange foliage -- blacks, browns and Silvers. Arid and harsh. A jungle, yes, but nothing like one he was in. There’s a craggy tree canopy overhead. Unn insect chattering and faint avian calls.
Powell?! POWELL!!! He grabs his equipment belt, checks his compass. Its need SPINNING wildly. His GPS readout is blank.

(into radio) Gold Team to base. This is Carter to base, do you read me? I've lost a fix on my position.  15. His radio CRACKLES and HISSES with static. And then he he different CLICK-HISSSS. CLICK-HISSSSS. An insect-like pur near his right ear. He turns, careful and slow...and sees a BABY MALAGOR perc a reed only inches from his cheek. Like a tiny four- wing pterodactyl. It cocks its head, curious. Even cute. --as the Baby Malagor BARES TERRIFYING FANGS and HISSES-- --and Carter RECOILS, instantly disappearing from frame--

head_text.subj: AND SLAMS BACKWARDS AGAINST A TREE TRUNK

text: Eyes shut, Carter winces, rubbing his skull. Back to the he lifts his head to see-- THAT HE‘S FIFTEEN FEET OFF THE GROUND Straddling a large branch, with the ground far below him. Baby Malagor hasn't moved. But it’s twenty feet away. Carter blinks, confused. He swings a leg over the branch and lowers himself, dangl a moment, then dropping carefully to the ground. He looks upward at the tree branch, fifteen feet up. Test the thought, he crouches low...and then leaps.

head_text.subj: AND SKYROCKETS WAY PAST THE BRANCH

text: Shooting far higher -- twenty, thirty, forty feet -- CRAS through branches and flailing for purchase. Finally, he g hold of one. Dangling, he looks down-- --and sees the tiny Baby Malagor still observing. Intrigu Carter drops from the tree, his hands trembling. He crouc grasping the ground as if afraid to let go.
What happened to gravity? Chancing it, Carter slowly rises back to his full height. Nothing happens. He surveys the terrain...
Carter comes SOARING from the forest canopy, arcing groun to land in a crouch. He's breathing hard, gauging the dis he just leaped...  16.

(incredulous) What happened to me...? He rises to face a rising rock slope. He picks up a large of black rock, testing its weight. To his amazement, he’s to toss it easily in his hand-- --and then he wheels and hurls it like a discus, watching PIROUETTE high over the rise and out of sight. Somewhere distant, there’s a creature’s throaty CALL of dismay. And off Carter's stunned reaction...

head_text.subj: A MASSIVE HERD OF FLYING MALAGORS

text: comes SOARING over the rise, dozens of them, riding the w like four-winged dragons. Carter dives for hiding as they over the trees...where the Baby Malagor gives Carter one HISS and ascends to join his family. Carter blinks. He can’t believe his eyes as he marches to edge of the rise for a vantage of--

Like an African savanna, with a shallow marshy pond below teems with a panoply of MARTIAN WILDLIFE. Bizarre desert predators the size of dinosaurs... ...and all framed against a STARSCAPE backdrop, with the planet rising prominently...a familiar ringed planet fill sky.
(stunned) I‘m dead... have to be... Above a nearby rock outcrop, he can see the top of a TALL TOWER. It looks man-made. His eyes narrow...

Staying out of sight of the watering hole predators, Cart scales the rocks for a view of what’s beyond... -.. and sees a great DOMED STRUCTURE built into the hills with a glistening egg-shaped dome. Its incongruity in the landscape and softness of its lines suggest that it was d and built.  17.

Carter jumps to a spire and looks down upon the dome... T a thick, curved, transparent roof, he sees HUNDREDS OF EG feet high, three feet in diameter, with a leathery white Sunlight is refracted through the dome and grows with int providing heat. The building’s purpose is clear - it is a INCUBATOR. --And guarding the entrance are two CALOTS - formidable, ferocious creatures about six feet long, as thick as a rh with ten stubby legs, frog-like heads with three rows of and tusks jutting from wide jaws. One might think of an ugly/cute English Bulldog when looking at them, but one c could eat five Earth dogs for breakfast. Carter hears a GROWL. Turning, he comes face-to-face with THIRD CALOT (whom he will later name WOOLA). Stouter than others, with an endearing patch of color around one eye, regards Carter with curiosity...
Easy boy... Woola GROWLS a low woola-woola-woola, and edges a step fo his eyes flaring with alarm..
...I’'m not going to hurt you... .+..as a HUGE SHADOW falls over both Carter and Woola, an realizes that’s what the beast was growling at. Carter sw hard...and swiftly spins--

head_text.subj: TO SEE A TWENTY-FOOT TALL WHITE APE

text: SHATTERING two RIGHT FISTS through the glass of the incub dome, CLAWS OPENING to snatch its newfound prey-- --just as Carter dives aside, and scrambles up -- only to BASHED by a hulking hairy forearm as it swings back, send COLLIDING through the incubator’s wall -- back outside. The maniacal creature has two legs, four arms and a head gorilla’s. Its claws SMASH into two of the eggs instead, hauling out TWO STICKY GREEN FETAL CREATURES. The mucous- covered, four-armed blind babies WRITHE and SQUEAL-- --as the White Ape devours them whole, gnashing jaws, slu and swallowing...and then turns Carter’s way.  18.
Carter grabs his pistol and OPENS FIRE. The bullets peppe Ape’s chest like BB’s. Completely harmless.

Not good-- He scrambles, colliding with one of the dead calots. The animal's ribcage is exposed -- and Carter's able to snap scimitar-like RIB for a weapon-- --just as the White Ape LUNGES for him, landing on its mi limbs and flashing out its upper claws-- --and Carter LEAPS straight up, just missing its grasp, t perch on the side of the dome. Surprised, the Ape turns-- ~-just as Carter takes a desperate jump -- right at it, EMBEDDING the rib in its neck as Carter sails past its sh and lands hard in the dirt, tumbling to a stop. The Ape H MADLY, staggered but not killed-- --and LEAPS again out of the enraged animal's grasp, land atop the rock outcrop and racing over its summit--~

text: into view to cut him off! Even larger and more savage tha first, it BACKHANDS two arms before Carter can react-- --swatting him like a fly to SMASH HIM BACK THROUGH THE D
--and crash-land among the eggs. A human throw toy. In ag Carter rolls onto his back. To see Woola the calot lying to him, with ugly but sympathetic eyes.

You take the big one-- As SMASH! The larger Male Ape LUMBERS through the destroy entry. The Female Ape LIMPS to his side, with the calot-r still stuck in her neck. They thrash the grasses as Carte Woola both scamper for better cover-- The Female Ape SCOOPS up an egg, bites off the top and su the fetal creature inside. She then CRUSHES the eggshell HURLS it at Carter, knocking him down-- --and allowing the Male to GRAB him! The Male raises him in the air, opening his savage JAWS wide, ready to thrust down his gullet--  19.

Taking a flying leap at the Ape‘s legs, SINKING jaws in a wrenching a leg out from under. The Male buckles, looseni grip -- and allowing Carter to tumble free. Trapped between them, Carter sees the Female blocks the e Carter glances to the roof, then steels his gaze-- And races at the Female. She drops low, ready for his cha until he plants off an egg and LEAPS skyward! Soaring straight up to the dome’s roof, where he hangs on broken girder with one hand, dangling right above her wid gnashing jaws-- Carter hangs on by one hand, about to fall to his doom... opens the other hand...to reveal a CONCUSSION GRENADE.

Compliments of the U.S. Army. And lets it drop. Right down the ape’s throat. The ape ROARS...and then gets silenced as the grenade DET ravaging the ape with internal injuries from its concussi force! The beast topples to ground, dead. Carter falls -- but lands safely in the silvergrass. The Ape BELLOWS mournfully, HURLING Woola at Carter. With a thundering run, he blocks any other escape. They’re done He BEATS his chest, and now CHARGES!--
With black blood and a GREEN FLASH, as if EXPLODING from The Ape staggers...and then topples, revealing--

head_text.subj: TWELVE SILHOUETTED RIDERS ON THE ROCKS BEYOND

text: Like a military platoon, except the silhouettes aren’t hu They are THARKS, twelve feet tall and four~armed green wa adorned in armor and battlements, riding THOATS, great pa horse/part-rhino cavalry animals. One among them holds a SMOKING RADIUM RIFLE. His gun give steady, “recharging” whine. The rest await this leader’s command. He is GENERAL TARS TARKAS. The riders descend the rocks, approaching. Twin tusks cur upward from their jawbones. Hairless heads, menacing face armed to the teeth with spears, swords and rifles.  20. Carter tenses -- he drops his “knife” and opens his hands show he means no harm. The Tharks (among them savage, scar-faced LIEUTENANT VAXX look to TARS TARKAS, the leader, awaiting an order. Tars motions for all to lower their guns.
(to Tars, gesturing angrily) Loquesh va baresh! Baresh ku tain! Tars holds him with a steely look. Vaxx falls silent. Car keeps a surrendering pose, but addresses Tars:
My name is John Carter. Do you understand me? Tars betrays nothing.
I’m not your enemy? I’m lost. I’m trying to find a friend.
(intrigued) Friend. Carter nods, warily relaxes. Tars lowers his rifle. And t points to his own armor:

Thark. Curious, Tars dismounts and notes the smashed incubator w the destroyed eggs, the two dead calots, and the wounded He picks up the blade fashioned from the rib, points at t white ape, and asks Carter...
Baresh?! Baresh ku tain? Getting the gist of the question, Carter nods in the affirmative, but moves to the wounded Woola and adds...
They attacked us. We were able to kill one. Upon hearing Carter’s English, the Tharks look befuddled. clanks as Tars raises a single finger...and presses it to Carter's chest. A testing touch.  21.

That‘’s right. Him and me. Tars nods, with some amusement, then strides past Carter examines the calot’s wound, calling to Vaxx who THROWS A at Woola! A shocked Carter SPRINGS in the air and SNATCHE saving the calot’s life.

No! He saved my life. The Tharks don’t know what to make of Carter’s leap! An a sound is heard as they look on in awe. TWO see it as an a aggression, LAUNCH spears at him, and Carter VAULTS to a avoiding both projectiles.
Heeding Tars‘s order, the warriors sheath weapons. Carter his thanks and returns to Woola...

These boys think you're done for. You want to live? Move. The calot “smiles” and gets to its feet. Carter looks to fars... The Thark nods - Woola will be spared. Tars Tarkas remains impossible to read...but something ak smile crosses his face...and he finally signals sharply. thunder of armor, all Tharks DISMOUNT at once. Vaxx curses, lowering his weapons, with vengeful eyes dir Carter‘’s way. And when Tars turns his back, Vaxx kicks W sent tumbling across the dust.

The Apes’ bodies BURN and their PELTS are loaded onto tho while Tharks are busy repairing the shattered dome. A stunned Carter sits prisoner, hands and feet bound by C Woola’s beside him, looking forlorn. They watch Tars marc the scene, commanding his soldiers-- --as Carter’s radio, on the ground beside him, suddenly S with the sound of GUNFIRE and LASER FIRE, as if tuning in interstellar war.  22.

A DOZEN THARK EGGS hang from baskets and braces, carried Thoats...as Tars Tarkas and his Thark platoon trek across seemingly endless hostile landscape. Amidst the caravan expedition, Carter sits bound atop a t a prisoner. His tired, ragged face looks toward the horizon...and his eyes widen, at what seems like a mirage For from the infinite desert rises a massive METROPOLIS..

Nestled in the deep recesses of a dry sea bed lies a crum DOMED city, looming over the tiny riders. Perched on high more MALAGORS. Two launch and SWOOP over the caravan, hel THARK RIDERS in cockpit harnesses. Tars gestures a signal and the Malagors return to the cit SCREECHING an announcement. Soon, TRUMPETS sound and a hu ENTRY GATE is opened.’..two massive iron doors hauled apa lumbering mastodon-sized ZITIDARS... An overwhelmed Carter cannot believe what he's seeing.-. is like watching a fairy tale come to life... Vaxx kicks forward, snapping him back to “reality.”

The caravan rides into a dense warren of reclaimed buildi sandstone streets, bustling with THARKS. Thousands of the Citizens BOW at the sight of Tars and his warriors, who a elite of Thark’s military. And they CHEER at the sight of eggs. Tars Tarkas subtly raises a hand to acknowledge the crowd acclaim. A murmur then ripples, as Tharks spot Carter -- regarding him with curiosity and scorn. He can only look with a mind that’s been completely blown...

In the city center, a bombed-out cathedral-like building over the rest. Once an architectural wonder, now a deteriorating monument to war. At the caravan’s fore, Tars Tarkas exchange salutes -- th crossing of mid-limbs -- with four PALACE GUARDS.  23.

The room was once a great library or museum left whatever ancient race built the city. Overturned shelves, tables and books litter the floor. Tal Hajus ROARS, angered by the interruption. Tars hurls the APE HEADS at Hajus’ feet. Hajus quiets. Ta calmly drops to a knee. The other Tharks do the same. Hajus frowns at the sight of the pale human, still standi
(to Carter, a command) Sakk.

Sakk. Tars points to the ceiling. Carter still hesitates. So Ta motions to his officers, who draw SWORDS and attack him-- --giving him no choice but to LEAP right over them, to a perch above the doorway! Tars BARKS another command. Tars smiles, looks to Hajus. can’t help but be impressed.
Sakk. He motions for Carter to come down. Carter does, warily.
My name’s John Carter, from America. Tars Tarkas and Tal Hajus trade a stare.
Mak jeddak. Lo Jonn-kata. Thark?  24. Hajus eyes Carter carefully, then sneers a dismissive han
Thark. BOOM! Palace GUARDS grab Carter, marching him brusquely f the room. And, he believes, to his execution...

Listen to me! I’m looking for a friend. You’re not my enemy, I mean you no harm. : ...and as he resists, the guards BLINDFOLD him and hold h fast...and finally head-butt him into submission. As his world GOES DARK.

Carter’s eyes snap open as he bolts up in bed -- a stack covered burlap, surrounded by chain-mail netting. He's be stripped to his army shorts. But he's alive. The room glows with FIRELIGHT. He sees his washed clothes hanging from a line. He sees a meal left on a table. And hears a throaty PURRING. Woola-woola-woola... Carter turns to see Woola guarding the door, licking his Carter’s eyes narrow...

Woola-woola-woola to you too. He hears RADIO STATIC from behind him. He spins to see an antechamber, where a lithe female Thark, SOLA, sits on th floor, exploring Carter’s military gear: dog tags, compas concussion grenade. She's fiddling with his radio-- CARTER . Hey! That‘s mine! Hey! --he runs over and she springs back, clutching the radio. tries to guard the rest of it--
Get out of here! Go! Mine! --but she bows repeatedly, submissive. He now sees a wash and a cookpit in her room. And now realizes.
You did all this. For me.  25.
Sola.
Sola. Sola smiles. In her hands, the radio SQUAWKS to life with inhuman cries and explosions. The sounds of battle. She p it to her ear. Carter‘s eyes widen--
What is that?! What are we hearing?
Zodanga. Lok Helium. Dak kavall. She sees he doesn’t understand. So she leads him to a bal stepping out to overlook--

the broken-domed city teeming with six-limbed, green-skin THARK behemoths. Bustling and training, marching in milit formation by torchlight. But Sola points to the horizon-- --where it GLOWS with FLICKERS of light, abrupt and sudde fireworks from a distant battle. Tiny TRACER LIGHTS are v -- some kind of airships. The FLASH-GLOW moves in concert what Carter’s radio is tuning in--
Dak kavall, she said. Dak kavall. (beat) The war.
Carter's sandy, bloodstained hands open a tiny military j and start to write...”My name is Captain John Carter, Dev United States Army. I ama prisoner of war...”

It was incredible. It was impossible. Somehow I had traveled millions of miles through space, and infinite years through time...and yet war remained. Here. Everywhere. War. ANGLE WIDENS to reveal Carter, writing by firelight. Sola asleep in her antechamber, Woola is asleep by the door...  26.
From that, there was no escape.

Carter emerges, followed by Sola and Woola. He wears his clothes, but with Thark touches: a makeshift armored breastplate and Thark DAGGER (which on him, seems a sword attracts the stare of all THARKS passing by...

The sight of Earth in the sky meant I was still in the same solar system. The red dust, the presence of water... to me, that meant Mars... or as Sola called it, Barsoom. And as for the Martians...Thark was the name -- for their people, their city, and as I came to soon realize...for me. EXT. THARK PLAZA -— DAY Carter and Sola join a CROWD at some kind of public cerem The dozen EGGS that were retrieved from the Incubator sit dais, with necklaces of GREEN FIRE-GEMS draped across the the crystals start to GLOW... ...the eggs crack open, and mewling THARK BABIES emerge, clambering out, sticky and new. The Thark Crowd ROARS, thrusting pikes and swords high. Carter stares, stunned.. ...for as the Babies first rise to stand, they are handed and PIKES of their own. Each then follows a MENTOR THARK a distant “training ground”...
This wasn’t a society, it was a militia. The males, females and children alike. And the general who'd spared my life...wanted me to be a part of it.
Tars Tarkas stands watching with his senior OFFICERS, as Thark Babies are taught to fight by their Mentors...

His name was Tars Tarkas. The rest feared him and obeyed him. To him, I was some kind of prize.  27. +++a€S ANGLE TRACKS the row to find Carter at the end, ho two pikes and learning to defend himself...from Sola.

The strength and agility I now possessed had worth to him in battle. It was all these creatures valued. It’s what they taught their young from the moment they were born. Strength. Valor. Victory. Carter PARRIES two of Sola’s (half-speed) blows, then HOP other two, but her fourth arm HURLS a pike that hits him air. He hits the dirt hard, armor dinged-- --and Sola has a blade to his throat. She shrugs. “Sorry.

Their training was much as mine had been. Attempt. Fail. Repeat and repeat again until you succeed. Then repeat until you excel. INT. CARTER’S QUARTERS - DAY A SLIMY MARTIAN RODENT is placed before Carter, on a dinn plate with a charcoal stick. He looks repulsed as Sola si across from him with a plate of her own...
The one called Sola remained at my side. From her, I began to learn some of their language. Carter motions to his mouth, fearing the worst...
Eat?
Tog. Jonn-kata toq.

Jonn-kata toq. He lifts the dripping rodent glop and takes a bite. Gray dribbles down his chin. He chews grimly. Sola wears an amused look. She takes her charcoal stick a strikes it on the table -- it FLAMES alight. She then ske her own gray glop with it. Immediately, the meat COOKS FR WITHIN, roasting to an appetizing smoky brown.  28.
As the days passed, I tried to find out what I could... There would be no help in my search for Powell.

Carter uses a STONE to draw an etching on the room's wall trying to depict the crevasse cave for Sola: CARTER . It was a cave...with ted crystals. Rocks -- like this -- but red. Vekk. Red. With a diamond in the center -- and when I touched it, it started, all the crystals connected... He draws connecting lines between the crystals he’s drawn (and Woola) watches patiently, trying to follow.
If it sent me here, it could send me back, right? Have you ever seen this? A cave like this? Sola shakes her head. Carter looks despondent...

She had no knowledge of a way home. Nor any knowledge of what had happened to Powell. But I would keep looking. EXT. CARTER’S QUARTERS - BALCONY - NIGHT Carter sits perched upon his balcony’s ledge, watching th off GLOW of a firefight beyond the mountains. He has his listening to STATIC and the faint thunder of bombs...
And every night, I listened to the sounds of war. There was another civilization out there -- one even the Tharks were afraid of -- but who they were and who they fought remained a mystery to me.
CRASH! A CHILD WARRIOR hits the ground, gored and bleedin rolling away from a bucking, gnashing THOAT -- the Tharks horse/half-rhino, razor-jawed pack animals.  29.

To the Tharks, I was an alien. An oddity, a pet. But the days turned to weeks, and all the while, Tars Tarkas was watching. Testing... Carter and Sola approach the corral -- enclosed by a fenc of ENERGY BEAMS. Tars Tarkas surveys the training...
And I knew my one chance of survival here was to master their fighting skills...

An ENERGY GATE retracts with a HUM, allowing a very reluc Carter to edge in. The simmering thoat SNORTS. But Carter studies the myriad scars on the thoat’s back.. instead unhooks his holster belt. His blades hit the dust Sola and other Tharks trade alarmed looks...

Easy girl. I won‘t hurt you. The thoat stamps hooves like a bull, razor-teeth bared. C reaches out a gentle hand-- --and the thoat CHARGES! Snarling, it lowers its head and COLLIDES with Carter -- who gets plowed backwards across ground -- toward the ENERGY FENCE! At the last second, he manages the leverage to PUSH OFF-- --and bolts SKYWARD, doing a single backflip, then plumme down headfirst just as the thoat REARS UP at the fence-- --as Carter LANDS squarely on its back, hanging on! The t enraged. Tars has seen enough. He BARKS a command to his Wranglers, who aim HARPOON RIFLES--
--and wrenches the thoat’s mane to turn her, just as the FIRE! The barbs WHISTLE past, piercing the dirt instead. Carter hangs on, pressed at the thoat’s ear--
Easy now...I won't hurt you... He strokes its flank in a steady rhythm that starts to ca The thoat stops bucking, settling down...  30.
I won't hurt you... ..-till she's finally at rest. Carter rides it over and dismounts, stroking its face. The other Tharks look mysti but Tars Tarkas sagely nods. Well done.
Carter again jousts PIKES with Sola. His hair has grown l and ragged. And this time he out-duels her...

Over time, the walls of my room became a comfort. The taste of my rations and the smell of the desert became familiar...even the sight of Earth in the midnight sky... Carter extends a hand to help Sola up. She seems surprise the gesture. But takes it.
And little by little, the language of the Tharks...became mine...
A flurry of activity as five THARK GUARDS race past Carte and Woola. Shouts and cries of alarm...which we hear Cart starting to “process”...
Lok kalos! Slokell! Munitions house! Intruders! He whirls, trying to follow...
Bakvor maggrey! Xanthok Sound the alarms! Alert Tarkas! General Tarkas!
BOOM! Five Thark Guards burst in -- with Carter and Sola find several dead CALOTS on the ground. Crates of weapons been smashed open and raided.
Warhoon!

Warhoon? What‘s a Warhoon?  31. Suddenly, a BARRAGE OF CROSSBOW BOLTS come whizzing from killing three of the guards! Carter and Sola spin to see FIVE SHADOWED SIX-LIMBED FIGU a ledge, scampering for a high window. Shaped like Tharks leaner and even meaner. Carter dives for cover-- --as more BOLTS come flying. The WARHOON ARCHERS clutch pillaged BUSHELS of weapons on their backs as they flee-- --so Carter grabs a RADIUM RIFLE and “charges” it expertl taking a bead on the stone ledge and FIRING! The ledge disintegrates, as three of the Warhoons FALL. T other two drop their stolen weapons and flee.

Carter LEAPS through the window in pursuit and GAMBOLS to outer city wall...where he sees two Warhoon Shadows slip into the desert night. He gets off two GREEN RADIUM BLAST they! explode into the sand...

Back at the window, Carter sees the Thark Guards FIRE mor radium blasts into the fallen Warhoons -- killing them. ( Warhoons are skeletal, Cro-Magnon versions of Tharks.) The Tharks then look to Carter, nodding with respect..
Tarkas vedd. Sek ott Thark General Tarkas is right. He verras. is truly a Thark. And off this admission, Sola smiles...

Sola was the only one who saw me listening. So she taught me more... INT. CARTER’S QUARTERS - DAY A CRUDE MAP of the planet is spread upon Carter's bed. He Sola sit cross-legged before it. She's explaining...

Malagors. Zitidars. Calots. Thoats. She told me her people lived lifespans of centuries. I wondered whether I would too. She told me of the Warhoon raiders they fought. And of the great war beyond the mountains -- between kingdoms called Zodanga and Helium. (MORE )

CARTER (V.O.) (cont'd) And of the fearsome Sab Than, the Desert Prophet, the Prince of Zodanga, who'd banished the Tharks to this wasteland nearly one hundred years ago. Carter finds his compass, with its lost, spinning needle, holds it up to the map. Explaining directions on Earth...

And through it all, she was the only Thark who ever asked me of my world. It was as if she'd given up on her own... Suddenly, there’s a POUNDING at ‘the door. Sola rises, an it...to find two stern-faced THARK OFFICERS. Her manner turns grave...as she faces Carter:
Mak tek terra. It is your time.

Carter's escorted through a crowd -- another ceremonial gathering -- toward the dais. As the way clears... +.-he sees Tars Tarkas waiting for him. With an officer's of THARK ARMOR. And off Carter's shocked look...
+++he WEARS THE ARMOR, standing before the Thark crowd as ROAR, thrusting pikes and swords high. Like a Knight of t Round Table...he's one of them now...

Within months...I had gained their acceptance. Was it months -- has it only been months? It is the first thing they teach you in the Army. If you are captured, learn the ways of your enemy. Live as they want you to. Win their trust. (beat) For with that, comes the way to escape. Suddenly, there's a WILD SCREECH from above! All Tharks l to see a MALAGOR circling and screaming! Two more join it their RIDERS shoot RED FLARES into the sky-- --as a LOUD KLAXON sounds, a warning cry throughout the c --as the ceremony falls apart! Tharks hurriedly race thro the streets, using mid-limbs as legs to resemble centaurs armed, armored and ready for--,  33.

(Note: From this moment on, we perceive all language on M as Carter does -- as dialogue we can understand.) Tars mounts his own thoat and races into the fray. Carter trails Sola, who charges up a PLAZA STAIRCASE to see--
Hurry, Jonn-kata! From the skies! We are under attack!
--several THARKS manning positions astride huge RADIUM CA launchers w/ gunner cockpits. Aiming skyward at--

text: Descending from gray cirrus,.:the craft is a half-mile lo an open-deck like a great PIRATE SHIP! A dozen “FIGHTER” ESCORTS zip past it -- as a steady STROBE LIGHT blinks fr ship’s bow. BLACK SMOKE tails from its EIGHTH RAY ENGINES It's badly damaged... -..and in the streets, Tars Tarkas notices. His eyes narr
KLAXONS and MALAGORS scream on as Tal Hajus marches an ou corridor with COUNCILORS, as Tars finds him--
My King! It is a Helium ship! It signals for help!
It is a trap. Fire at will.
We have not been attacked!
General Tarkas. Every second you doubt is a second Tharks die. Turn back the assault. (with venom) Kill everything on that ship.

On city rooftops, great GREEN BANNERS are snapped open, l signals to the Thark Malagor pilots above--  34. --who SOAR INTO BATTLE, gripping their mounted PULSE GUNS their Malagors SWOOP up to meet the Helium Fighters--

--while THARK MARKSMEN fire and the main airship is ROCKE Only now do the Helium forces return fire -- two FIGHTERS the city as RADIUM CANNONS on the main ship launch EMBER which spiral like catherine wheels, spitting WHITE SPARKS they hit the streets and DETONATE-- --COARSING down alleyways and into buildings, cutting dow Tharks in the plaza -- with a bolt ZIPPING right at Carte --just as an armed-to-the-teeth THARK races blindly past, the EMBER-FRAG rips him in two instead. Spared by fate, C picks up the fallen Thark’s rifle and runs on.
Meanwhile, Tars bounds to where FIXED ARTILLERY is perche tractor-trailer-sized CROSSBOWS with coils of rope cables Operators take aim on the mother craft--

--and huge STEEL GRAPPLES are shot into the sky, trailing taut cable -- and IMPALE the skin of the battleship! In m moments, a half-dozen cables have hold of the ship-- --and their cable coils start to retract. Like a whale harpooned, the great airship is pulled toward the city! I engines GLOW with heat, but it can’t escape the cables!

Carter scampers to a high vantage, across an alley from T artillery post. Tars and co. are focused ahead, and don't notice a Helium FIGHTER soaring at them from behind-- --so Carter LEAPS to an unoccupied RADIUM CANNON, turning cockpit to take aim up-- --just as Tars spins to see Carter’s cannon aimed at him- --just as Carter SHOOTS a BLAST that whistles past Tars a SHATTERS the hull of the coming FIGHTER! The one-man flie WOBBLES, thrown off course... and Tars FIRES a second sho hitting the engine as the fighter EXPLODES! Tars nods a look of gratitude... then roars to his men:

As the battle rages, the airship’s ENGINES and CANNONS ar obliterated. Like a hooked and netted fish, it’s hauled t the city’s broken dome, colliding below rooftops-- --and allowing cheering THARKS to drop onto the ship’s de Tars puts his rifle over a cable and SLIDES onto the ship descends into view for Carter-- -- see it TEE! with Hi -SIZED ENEMY S. ORS! The only difference is their RED SKIN. They shoot RIFLES and draw desperate SWORDS, suddenly desperately overmatched--

(astonished) They‘re human... --by the Tharks who SWARM their deck, cutting them down l right. Carter watches from the rooftop as Tars SLASHES hi through ten men all by himself... He stares as Tharks rid the airship of every RED MAN, hur bodies to the ground below. AND AT THE AIRSHIP‘S EDGE ENGINES FLARE as one HELIUM INTERCEPTOR craft TAKES OFF! an escape jet with a shrouded cockpit, bat-shaped and sle --it rockets skyward just as Tars spots its flight! He FI his rifle and just MISSES! The Interceptor SPARKS and SMO as it jets skyward, disappearing in the distance-- VAXX O.S. General Tarkas! Tars and Carter turn to see Vaxx drag from the ship a SQU FIGURE hidden by a rose-colored cloak. The captive elbows and slips past him... The Tharks LAUGH at the futility of escape attempt as the figure runs toward Carter who instinctively raises his sword to strike-- --as the figure‘'s cloak and hood fall away--

head_text.subj: TO REVEAL THE PRINCESS OF MARS

text: A red-skinned, raven-haired woman, beautiful and strong, fine silks with a bare midriff, highlighted by a DIAMOND in a gold setting at her navel. This is DEJAH THORIS.  36. Carter stops in mid-strike, blade held high. It‘s an ange before him -- the most beautiful woman he's ever seen. An Dejah is just as confounded -- to see a man in Thark rega Astonished, Carter lowers the sword-- Behind him, Tars, Vaxx and a dozen THARK SOLDIERS have ar Dejah scampers up, trapped--

General Tarkas -- I'm here for you! Please listen to me! I've traveled to Thark for you! Tars motions to his soldiers. As they brusquely drag her she meets eyes with Carter. She gets only confusion, no g of sympathy. So her eyes harden -- and look away. Tars nods to Carter, with genuine respect. Then marches o his wake, Sola appears...
(still shell-shocked) Your enemy...they’re like me...

No, Jonn-kata. Not like you. {a proud smile) You are alive. As if on cue, EXPLOSIONS ring out from the huge battleshi hull, sending a FIREBALL of acrid smoke and flames into t framing Tars in a portrait of awesome destructive power. Consumed by the glee of brutal victory, the Tharks raise swords and fire rifles! And Carter can only watch... .-.-with both remorse and the fear of what's to come. cuT TO:
Out of the clouds SHOOTS the second Helium Interceptor -- lone ship to escape Thark -~ soaring the sky toward...

above verdant green plains, where ZODANGAN AIRSHIPS and H AIRSHIPS are dueling the skies, trying to shift the front of what is clearly a massive war. The Interceptor nimbly dives and dodges low, above ZODANG GROUND TROOPS -- tens of thousands deep -- as they exchan volleys of LASER FIRE with HELIUM ARMED FORCES, holding t atop a ridge, beyond which lies--

An awe-inspiring futuristic metropolis, made of hovering sections, in a crater valley of rivers and waterfalls. A FORCE SHIELD around the city flickers with ENERGY RIPPL it withstands enemy bombardment. Fully under siege. The Interceptor flies in, banks beneath a FLOATING PALACE
--and docks into position amidst HUNDREDS more. Its red Y PILOT hits the access catwalk, met by red OFFICERS:

The Princess is lost. INT. KING’S QUARTERS - DAY The King of Helium, TARDOS MORS, 60’s, great gravitas, si head bowed. Around his neck he wears a DIAMOND STONE, in royal crest mounting. The Young Pilot stands before him, flanked by HELIUM GENERALS.
Do you know her fate?
No, your Majesty. She was alive... The King raises his head, grieving done.
Then there’s still a chance.

It was madness, your Majesty. To place her hope in the Tharks-- Tardos Mors stands, using a silver cane. Steps to a windo overlook FORMAL GARDENS, where a HOLOGRAPHIC FIGURE in a stands amidst cherry blossom trees. Back turned.

Sab Than is waiting, your Majesty. EXT. FORMAL GARDENS -— DAY The dark-cloaked HOLOGRAM is SAB THAN, the young Prince o Zodanga, 30. The lower half of his face is red-skinned, w Maori-like markings. The top half is shrouded by a HELMET  38. He watches the cherry blossoms fall around him, and indee through him, with a wistful sort of stare...
It's a tragedy, your Majesty, that a place of such beauty...must be destroyed in order to be saved.
The tragedy is to believe that. Sab Than’s hologram turns...to see Tardos Mors -- old and Yet his diamond pendant shines. Overhead, the city’s forc shields SHUDDER, absorbing enemy blasts.
You can’t survive. Surrender and you save the lives of millions.
But not their future.

I was raised in the desert -- over one hundred years ago. Do you know what life is like there? A drop of rain, a blade of grass...they are all miracles. (beat) In time, this entire planet will be a desert. Its people will all need miracles. Why is Helium unwilling to try?
We can share what resources we have. We can’t control nature.
But we can... This planet is dying! So you will deliver me the Atmosphere Plant or I will destroy your Kingdom to take it!
It can’t be controlled. It can only be protected. If you try to override the Plant, it will destroy us all!
According to you!
According to those much wiser than me.  39.
I offer the people a miracle. I've won their hearts and minds. What do you have to offer them?
Peace. Sab Than’s hologram stares darkly.
There is peace in death, your Majesty.
A HOLOGRAM of Tardos Mors VANISHES...as angle reveals SAB in the flesh, turning to a window overlook--

A TOWERING METROPOLIS OF DARK METAL ISLANDS among smog- c Each islarid*is supported by massive stilts. It’s a jungl of Soviet-style architecture -- slums upon slums, like a blackened scab upon the sky’s foul soot blanket. Giant ZODANGAN AIRSHIPS are sky-docked at platforms, with SOLDIERS scurrying to re-arm and re-supply. It is clearly well-oiled war machine...as Sab Than turns to a GENERAL:
No mercy.

Doors THUNDER OPEN to reveal a court-like rotunda. Eight THARKS, the War Council, flank a central pulpit -- where Hajus slumps in a lazy, draconian pose. Carter slips in, desperate to find the princess. An assem THARK OFFICERS watches as Dejah is brought before Hajus. fore are Tars, Vaxx and Sarkoja.
Princess of Helium. How unexpected. To what do we owe the hostilities? Despite the environs, she’s far from intimidated:
Commander Hajus, I demand the safe treatment of my ship’s prisoners--
What prisoners?  40.
(pure bitterness) You’re even more savage than your reputation.
And you more beautiful. Enough compliments.
We were a damaged vessel requesting safe harbor. We returned fire only when provoked--
Lack of wisdom in red men surprises no Thark. The Thark audience laughs. Dejah sees Tars Tarkas doesn't

We were engaged -by Zodangan warships over the Korus Hills. Mine was a diplomatic mission. My destination was Thark. There’s a MURMUR of surprise among the assembled Tharks. Hajus narrows his eyes as the murmur grows...

For decades, we have maintained the entire planet’s water supply, despite the brutal interference of your Tharks. You know that if not for our scientific operations, there wouldn’t be the resources on Mars to support a single life -- green or red. Hajus scowls, but doesn't dispute this.
Within days, my city will fall. only an alliance will save us both--
Your war with Zodanga is not Thark concern.
Sab Than wants the Atmosphere Plant. He intends to override it. Another MURMUR in the audience...this one of worry...  41.

It provides our air, our water, our existence. It has run itself since the dawn of time! Is that for one man to control? If it even can be controlled? Hajus gives a dismissive wave. Dejah meets the gaze of Ta Tarkas...and now turns toward him...
That Plant was a gift from the Orovars, the creators -- beyond our science and understanding. My people have sworn to protect it~-
You will addressss Commander Hajusss!
I address all Tharks.
Ssstrike her! Ssstrike her down!
(pleads with Tars) I promise you, this is your fight. Tharks once knew the meaning of honor. You were more than thieves and killers - - until this King--

It's Vaxx who heeds the command. He charges Dejah and BAC her to the floor! Her navel's DIAMOND STONE is again reve as Vaxx is upon her, raising his sword-- --only to have it PARRIED aside with a CRASH of metal tha the blade flying from his hands!-- --as Vaxx spins to see Carter standing there. Sword ready
Try again and I'll kill you. The entire council GASPS -- hearing Carter speak their la Even Tars looks astonished.
He speaks...? Our language?  42. The entire room of Tharks now STANDS, drawing WEAPONS. Bu Carter stands his ground as Dejah raises herself on one e watching with wide, staring eyes.
Take the Earth Man away! He has no right in this War Council!
But he does, my King. He is the Thark who captured her. He has the right to name her fate.
The Earth Man?!
It is the law. Another MURMUR as all wait to see Hajus’ reaction...
This is a Thark? Then let him die like a Thark-- Carter looks up to see -- BAM! -- Vaxx's four hands SHOVE backwards. Vaxx calls to all assembled:
I demand Justice}! Carter doesn’t know what's happening. Tars now looks grim does Dejah, now held captive by Sarkoja...
“Justice,” what’s “justice”...
You have been challenged, Jonn-kata. Vaxx takes a sudden step toward him -- so Carter spins, p both his DAGGER-SWORDS defensively--
The weapon is chosen. Vaxx nods smugly. And draws his own daggers -- four of th
What is this? For what?
For honor, Jonn-kata. From this moment on, only one of you may live.  43. Carter meets Dejah's eyes. He’s in this for her...

I wonder, princess. How many fools have gone to their deaths...over you? And Vaxx CHARGES! Lunging with all FOUR DAGGERS, whipping wildly. Carter PARRIES two blows, but a third CLANKS off armor and a fourth SLASHES his side! Carter buckles to a as Vaxx brings his two free arms SLASHING DOWN-- --and Carter dive-rolls forward -- through Vaxx's legs -- nick of time. He looks up to see Vaxx charge again-- --but this time Carter drops into a fighting stance, both ready. He backs up, PARRYING a succession of four blows - when Vaxx swings them in pairs-- --Carter ducks the two high strikes and PARRIES the two l Vaxx brings the high arms slashing down and Carter parrie those. When the low arms strike from the side-- --Carter forcibly splits the held high blades, leaping up FORWARD FLIP and landing a SLASH to Vaxx'’s shoulder. Blo spurts and the Thark buckles! The Thark audience REACTS as Carter lands in a ready crou Vaxx spins, PIROUETTING TWO BLADES at him-- --and just as they’re about to ROTOR into Carter's face, flashes his daggers up, KNOCKING them harmlessly aside. V extra daggers skitter into the crowd.

And now you think differently? (beat) Yet you live among Tharks, you wear their armor, you speak their language. He points to the starscape beyond the balcony:
I’m from Earth. The future. I’m here by mistake. We were lost in a cave -- a friend and I -- and we ended up here. All I want is to find him and return home. Have you seen or heard of a man like me?
No. A weighted beat between them.
You believe there is a way back.

The Orovars. (off his look) They were the ancestors of all life. (MORE)

DEJAH (cont'd) They traveled the galaxies, colonizing planets. They built the Atmosphere Plant that makes Mars inhabitable, they built our canals, our cities -~ and then vanished a million years ago. Yeah. .Yeah it does... She smiles, emboldened.
This is why we fight.

Tal Hajus will keep me prisoner. Red men are all the same to him. He blames us all for his people's exile.
And if I were to help you? She looks up, surprised.
Would you help me in return? Your kingdom has ships, communications... to help me search for my friend. Dejah studies his gallant face...with a newfound hope...
Beyond this city lie oceans of desert - - full of Warhoons and worse. It will take days to get to Helium...if it even still stands.  51.
I’1l take the chance.

I'll have tried. She searches his eyes, trying to allay last suspicions...
Then tell me, John Carter. How do we escape ten thousand Tharks? Their whispering faces are close enough to kiss...there's charge in the air...but Carter remains focused:
By deciding to leave. Carter backs into the shadows, and with one last look, disappears over the side of the balcony... as Dejah turns to the window and allows a troubled smile.

John Carter. Of Earth. +.-and as she looks to the stars, ANGLE moves past her to hidden GRATE in the high shadows of the ceiling. From a r perch above...a pair of THARK EYES gleam... Sarkoja has been watching.

Perfect.  53.

opens right behind him. A staring pupil, the size of Cart entire head. At a SNORT, Carter slowly turns...

Skying a pure vertical --he comes even with the tower's stairs and jumps off. Where is she?
Carter and Sola rush out to see two THARK GUARDS lying de felled by radium gunfire. Carter’s still astonished:

You stood up against him -- in the Council. You remind us it is possible. She wears a look of pride...and remains resolute...
You won't survive the desert, Jonn- kata. Not alone.

Take me to her...

That's a sweet little girl. To think she once despised me...  57.

Your “kingdom says’ they'll pay any reward I name. Who would be worth that...amidst a war? Not one life. Not even a princess. (slyly) Only what she has. Or what she knows.
You are mistaken. Hajus merely nods, leaving the Banth...
You reds with your scientific prowess, your knowledge, your secrets. What have you ever shared with my people? The princess backs away...

You think of us as savages. But let me ask you: when the last lakes dry up, when the winter rains cease...what will any of us be but savages? STORMCLOUDS surround...with FLASHES OF HEAT LIGHTNING on horizon, as amidst dunes of VOLCANIC ASH...rests a dead M half-buried. From beneath one of its wines... struggles a battered, as covered Carter. But he’s alive. He surveys the clouds...
Tars Tarkas?! TARS TARKAS!!! But only wind HOWLS back. So he crawls up the dune...wher confronted with a black desert vista...

poking out of the ash. Weakly, Carter pulls himself towar and as he reaches for the flower~- --his hand passes through a curtain of ash...to touch the on the other side. Where the air is still. Carter drags himself forward, through the weather “curtai

text: In a grassy expanse, utterly calm, and towering above him

A GIANT COLUMN of twisting white clouds rises three miles the air from it, feeding the very atmosphere of Mars. It' the eye of a hurricane. Storm winds swirl all around it, here -- on the inside -- all is calm. The sheer metal edi ‘has no doors, no windows. No way inside. Awestruck, Carter staggers to the wall of the building -- covers four square miles and towers two hundred feet. He to the ground, exhausted...

The whole war...over this... He laughs ruefully, delirious from his trek. His laughter convulses his body -- he winces, holding his wound. And t keels over. The wound is really hurting him now-- --and as he looks down, he sees a STRANGE GLOW coming fro side, like a hot coal inside his skin, as his scar starts split apart. His flesh grows WHITE HOT--

SEARS out from his side, “projecting” on the wall of the like a CURTAIN OF ENERGY, which causes a DOOR-SIZED SECTI the wall to RIPPLE INTO VIEW-- --and then the section of wall VANISHES as if it were nev there, revealing a long silver corridor! And the BEAM OF LIGHT cuts off, leaving a WHITE HOT INGOT Carter’s side as it slips free out of the wound--  93. -- al itse to be Dejah‘s DIAMOND ‘ONE. It hits the ground and cools, all its energy receding. Carter stares in complete amazement...
The key.

A long hall, with another RIPPLING “DOOR” at the end. It’ an airlock -- between a space where the laws of physics a and another where they don't. And as Carter walks through, clutching the “key” in his hand...his WOUNDS mysteriously heal, his skin is CLEANED ash...and his limping gait becomes strong and sturdy...as passes through the beckoning “ripple”~-

--into the plant itself. He finds himself on a balcony, overlooking a METROPOLIS-SIZED EXPANSE OF MACHINERY. It e for miles ahead, miles above and miles below. And as he turns to where he expects the “door” to be, he it extends for miles behind hin.

Welcome, John Carter. Carter spins back to see a TINY OLD MAN in a cloak, inche from his face, seemingly hovering above the machinery cha He's impossibly aged, nearly mummified, but with a slight enlarged head and features...and white skin.
Who...are you...
The one who remained. (beat) On all our worlds, there is always one who remains. Carter reacts, incredulous. The man’s mouth has not moved speaks telepathically.
I am the last of the Orovars. The little man hovers before him. Expressionless.  94.
You...you run the Plant?
It runs itself. I merely stay.
Why?
In the event we ever must come back, I must let the others know. That Mars is safe. That life goes on. (beat) It is the same with your planet Earth.
You know where I'm from... The Orovar nods sagely.
What else do you know?

That you wish to return. With that, the Orovar waves a slow hand... With a familiar HUM, a TRANSLUCENT PEDESTAL rises from th depths of the plant -- until it’s level with their platfo Then a CANOPY OF RED FIRE-GEM CRYSTALS shimmers into view around it -- just like the portal chamber in the cave.
Our pathways were never meant to be discovered. Our worlds should never have crossed. With another wave, a HOLOGRAM WALKWAY, like a shimmering appears -- from the platform to the pedestal.
Is that...my way home...?
Your way is of your own volition. He motions Carter onto the holo-walk. Carter takes a step it‘'s translucent and shimmering, but it's solid.  95.
I don't understand. If you Orovars can create worlds, create life...why don't you interfere? With the fates you've set in motion?
It is our science.
And your planets are...experiments?
That we may one day know the essential nature...of whatever intelligence created us. Carter advances, nearing the portal. But then...
What will happen if Powell takes over the Atmosphere Plant?
To attempt to control it will be to destroy it.
Then you'll stop him.
One does not stop an experiment.
You'll just stand by? You’ll just watch this planet die? The Orovar stares patiently. As if dealing with a child.
I helped start this war. You know that? It’s my fault he’s here.
In science, there are causes. There is no such thing as fault.
Someone has to tell him! That all this can't be controlled! Someone has to stop him! Carter stares at the diamond stone in his hand...  96.
What if the key remains inside the Plant?
It is one. It is not the only.
Goddammit! Don’t you know what's happening?! There’s a war out there and millions are dying! Why won't you involve yourself?!
Why won't you. He speaks without judgement. Carter despairs, looks to th portal. The beckoning crystals...the way home...
And would I survive? Would she? The Orovar says nothing.
I’m one man. What can I do?

Yes, John Carter. Forever and always. That is the experiment. With a heavy sigh, Carter sets his jaw...and steps to the pedestal. The crystal canopy begins to GLOW, and a HUM ri The Orovar lifts a farewell hand... The HUM grows deafening. The crystals BLAZE RED. And Cart conflicted face is bathed in a BLINDING GLOW...
The field of blue flowers is serene and still...as a pair BOOTS step out from the plant. _ Carter emerges... .+-and turns to see the Orovar in the RIPPLING “doorway.”
Never leave a man behind. The little man hovers with a faint smile on his face. Sci interest? Envy? Pride?

Look to the southwest skies.  97. And then the “doorway” turns opaque...and is a wall again Carter turns to the “curtain” of weather...starting to re his choice...and now stares skyward, hearing faintly...
Jonn-kata, are you out there?! CAN YOU

Amidst the stormclouds, the Zodangan Assault Flier HOVERS Tars Tarkas at the helm. He struggles to control the ship his SEARCHLIGHT sweeps the dunes-- --and now illuminates Carter rushing into view, waving ar signal. With amazement, Tars broadly smiles...
From the STORM CLOUDS, the Assault Flier SHOOTS away, fla flares of LIGHTNING...with Tars and Carter aboard. Tars turns to see Carter staring at the receding storm.
What happened to you back there?
(a distant stare) I saw my future. Tars turns back to the flier’s controls, smoke pours from underside as the engines STRAIN.
Why did you come back?
I saw a friend in trouble.
A...friend... Tars frowns as if it’s a word he’s only heard about.

I have ten thoats, Jonn-kata; you may take your choice from among them, and I will accompany you to the nearest waterway that leads to Helium. (off Carters look) Tars Tarkas may be a cruel warrior, but he can be a friend as well.  98.
And what happens when you return to Thark without me?
Death, possibly, or worse. (beat) Is this not a choice “friends” make?
Why do you fight for him? The great Thark stops. Something registers.
A soldier follows orders.
From the Thark who killed his family? Tars' eyes narrow suddenly.
I know about her, General. How she kept your name a secret. How she died to save you and your child.
No...you know nothing...
I know you once fought for her. You once fought for love.
I heard the story from your daughter herself. From Sola. Turning toward him, Tars suddenly stops as if shot.
She’s a prisoner of Zodanga -- along with the princess. She believes in a better way for her people.
Sola? Tars wears a distant, dark stare.  99.

On my planet, armies march for flags and leaders. But we fight for our family and our children. I know of no greater honor than that. Tars looks as if he’ll kill Carter then and there. But in he turns away...
I have orders, Jonn-kata. To return to Thark.
Then we go together. Tars stops. Looks back.

And you can watch one more life end for you. Tars turns away and stares over the bow...at another Heli FARMING SETTLEMENT below -- all skeletons and scorched ea now. And off the dark look in Tars’ eyes...
The Assault Flier SOARS across the desert. Atop a city wa CANNON GUNNERS draw a bead...until they hear a distinctiv HORN. And now see Tars Tarkas at the helm...
The War Council is in session, with Tal Hajus slumped in central pulpit. An elder Councilor is speaking--
But my King, the desert wells will not sustain us. And Zodanga refuses us fair rates of trade--
Tharks will survive! We have always survived! Let the red men slaughter each other and we will remain-- Suddenly, the doors THUNDER open as a Thark GUARD races i
A Zodangan ship--!  100.
A war council is in session--!

It is General Tarkas! A MURMUR in the room. Hajus’ face falls...as suddenly a T rides right in to the council chamber, with Tars Tarkas a Carter his prisoner. Tars dismounts, hauls Carter down-~- --spilling him to the floor, hands bound, before the coun
He is found. Hajus scowls to see Tars alive...but hides his displeasur
Then let us have his execution.
I’ demand the right to speak:
(to Tars) Cut him apart. First his tongue. Tars hesitates. Tal Hajus eyes’ narrow with suspicion.
General Tarkas--
He is still a Thark. Last words are his right. Hajus glowers, feeling the stare of the War Councilors.
Speak. Then you die. Carter slowly stands, and faces.the Thark audience:

Soldiers of Thark...I’ve been one among you. I've fought shoulder to shoulder. You're a brave people and you love bravery, but is that all? Tal Hajus dreams of war -- of carnage and suffering. While you true warriors dream...of an end to it all. (turns to Hajus) You’ve made your people into an arsenal, not an army. (MORE).  101. CARTER (cont'd) You‘re merely weapons that kill -- without asking what you’re killing for.
For Thark!
Which Thark? Who? Tell me just one name. One Thark whose life matters more than your own. All await his answer. And he has none...
What “one Thark”? All of Thark! Only a child would mourn the death of just one Thark! (to Tars, rages) Enough, Tarkas! Kill him! Now! But Tars doesn’t move. His eyes are on Carter's.
So Hajus himself draws four BATTLE AXES and LEAPS DOWN fr pulpit, only to have Tars step in front of Carter:
I demand Justice. An astonished gasp from the room...
I challenge you. Hajus stares, stunned...as Tars pulls his own four swords whole War Council is watching...

Here is your death. - And Hajus charges. Their weapons CRASH together, with thundering two-armed s It’s a meeting of veteran warricrs -- despite Hajus’ corp he's a worthy opponent. They strike and spin, powering st against steel-- --as their multi-limbs bash the BLADES back and forth. Ha charges like a wild bull, keeping Tars off-balance. He fi like a Thark possessed, unbowed by any HITS that Tars lan He’s starting to wear Tars down-~-  102. --and KNOCKS three of his swords from his hands with a RO sweep of his axes. Tars now holds a lone sword-- --and now glances to Carter, remembering their “fencing” Tars takes a balanced stance-- --and as Hajus gleefully CHARGES for the kill, Tars moves on a single axis, PARRYING all four strikes with only one own. Hajus’ last lunge leaves him off-balance-- --and Tars now ATTACKS, lunging forward, moving Hajus bac his heels, seizing an opening, SWEEPING his sword-- --and he CUTS OFF the King's head. The rest of Tal Hajus to the floor. A shocked silence in the room. Then Tars turns to face the assembled THARK OFFICERS...an does, they all kneel. For him now. Tars regards the elders of the War Council. They Bow thei heads in deference too.
It is Justice...my King. Finding Carter’s eyes, Tars gets a nod of gratitude and r And Carter kneels too.
We await your command.

Tars Tarkas clambers atop the ruined gates, where HUNDRED THARKS have assembled, with more coming, as news of their King spreads. There’s excitement in the air... -.-and from around a corner, a calot comes running at ful speed, just as Carter turns in amazement--
Woola...?! --as Woola, alive and well, tackles him to the ground, sl him with a grotesque tongue! He‘s streaked with SCARS fro radium bolt. But loyal and overjoyed...
Yeah, okay, okay -- I’m happy to see you too, yeah, all right... And as he struggles up, Tars address the growing crowd:  103.

Soldiers of Thark! Our planet has long been dying, yet forever have the Tharks survived! And forever more we will. But only if Zodanga falls. For they fight for a fantasy...that will destroy us all. (beat) The peaceful people of Helium shall never defeat Zodanga alone, nor will we, but together...there is hope. He trails off, surveying the stone Thark faces. No signs like minds. But still, he tries:
Tharks have never made alliances, and this is not our war. I will not command you to go. However, any Thark who volunteers... He looks to Carter below, in the gateway:
-.-we'll take him. A moment‘s silence, and then one of Tars’ senior officers Jakkal, steps up beside Carter.
We will take him. And then a boyish young Thark Captain joins the group...
We will take him. .--and now the words start to spread into the crowd, like rallying cry, as swords are lifted...
We will take him./We will take him! We will take him!/WE WILL TAKE HIM! And as the cries build to a deafening THUNDER, with sword pikes thrust into the air, Tars meets Carter's eyes...
The great doors are thrown open, casting light on the mig pack-animal ZITIDARS as THARKS rush in to prepare them.  104.
THARKS swarm the weapons cases, piling armfuls of blades, and armaments. Girding for war.
BLACK-AND-GREEN FLAGS whip in the wind -- standards held THARK RIDERS on thoats. Tars paces before them, with Cart War Councilors nearby:
Our city alone willbe no match. There are six other tribes of Tharks amidst the desert. You must enlist as many as you can.
They have never fought under a common flag, my King.
It is not a flag they will fight for. He spins back to the contigent of riders, bellowing:

Tell them Tars Tarkas will be the first into battle! With or without them! For he would rather fight and die, then to wish that fate upon his children! Tell them the great city of Thark fights for no flag, but for our mothers and fathers, our daughters and sons!

Officers and soldiers are busy with maps and screens -- o IMAGES of the Assault on Helium. Its patchwork force shie severely damaged. How much more death are you willing to witness, princess?
One. She stares daggers. Powell smiles thinly. He motions to a TECHNICIAN, who brings up on-screen images of three float Helium AIRSHIPS, apparently taken captive.
We captured these refugee ships en route to your polar outposts. Tell me what I want and I will spare them. (beat) Where is the key? Dejah watches the screen, says nothing. This destroys her

On Earth, there was once a great war -- a war for the whole world. Do you know what it took to end it? The death of innocents. Of whole cities. And if that's what Mars requires ... (firmly) I only take your lives to save them. More tears roll down Dejah’s face. Powell turns to his Of to give the last command, when--
Princess! :
(hisses) Silence! Powell stops. He studies the look that passes between the the revelation dawns...
You know... (incredulous) The Thark knows. Sola looks wary. Dejah glares a look of resolve.
Tell me the key’s location, Thark... and the princess lives. Powell draws his sword and puts it to Dejah’s throat.
Silence, Sola! I command you!
Tell me.
Sola's torn. Dejah’s stare is resolute. And as Powell pre the swordpoint, drawing blood...
Jonn-kata. Jonn-kata has the key.  107. And off Powell's astonished look...

A Zodangan FLIER passes, on patrol... as Woola pops into from a ROCK OUTCROP. He surveys the distant thicket of “s reaching high into the noxious clouds-- --and woola-woola-woolas that the coast is clear to Carte and the fifty-Thark STRIKE FORCE laying in wait. Tharks u TENTED CAGES atop two ZITIDARS-~- --to reveal MALAGORS inside. A way to reach the skies.
Among the stilts, four Malagors SOAR into the clouds -- e ferrying ten Tharks, faces shielded by scarves--
Do not breathe until we are past the red men’s poisons... --and Carter presses a scarf over his face too as they en PLUMES of GRAY and BROWN...
Where Powell now approaches Sola with the sword...

Jonn-kata was hurt in our escape. When the princess tended to his wound, she placed the stone from her royal crest inside it. (looks away) She does not know I saw her... Powell’s stunned. He marches to Dejah and rips her silks to reveal the gold mounting at her navel. Empty of its di stone.
You had your key.
You entrusted this planet to him? He's ready to strike her -- then spins to his officers:
Send ships back to Warhoon lands! Talk to every single savage and find the Earth Man's grave!  108.
What makes you so sure he has one...

Amidst the THUNDEROUS deployment of further troops -- uns whisper-quiet -- the Malagors ASCEND to castle level-- --encountering a trio of LOK-WING GLIDERS on patrol, but the shocked Pilots can sound an alarm, Thark ARCHERS shoo from the skies! The Malagors land on the parapets of Castle Zodanga, as t Thark strike force leaps off and slips into the shadows. Tars, Carter and Woola among them...
Powell stalks toward Dejah...

There was a time I envisioned a future for us, Princess. A peaceful union of our cities. You and I, side by side. (beat) But I learned one thing on Earth. Peace is the time between wars. It’s never the end in itself. He draws his sword as he’s almost there...
We're at war, Princess. You are my enemy. This is your end. And as he raises his sword high to strike her down--
Princess of Helium! Powell spins to the far doors to the war room...where Car stands alone, radium pistol aimed right at him...

Your mission is accomplished. The entire room of officers and technicians is momentaril frozen. One man? Alone? And then they watch as Tars Tarka step to his side. And then two more Tharks. And then ten. as Powell realizes--

Woola runs wild... ..-and as Tars MOWS through Zodangans, he reaches the bac the room, where fallen Sola lies unconscious, still chain Tars stops still at the sight of her. He’s overcome with emotion -- and collapses to her side--
Sola...Sola, hear me... He brushes her face, as her eyes flutter open. She starts brighten, then troubled, looks away--

Princess of Thark.

--and Carter emerges on scene to see the ship LEAVING the Drifting away with an arcing turn...twenty feet...forty...seventy... --and as Carter meets Dejah‘s eyes, at the open hatchway- --he never breaks stride, racing the length of the dock-- AND LEAPING INTO THE AIR’ “~? With a hard step off the dock’s edge...skying an arc towa ever-departing ship-- --a full mile above the unseen ground below-- --and as his seventy-foot arc nears its end, perilously c falling short, Dejah extends both arms out the hatchway--
At the very last second! Their arms lock like trapeze art as his weight pulls her body down the hatchway...but her catch hold on support rails! They hang from the ship as i SPEEDS UP and ASCENDS!
